function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Ineffective use of wearable sensors (WS) leading to limited disease monitoring and control.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread due to lack of effective monitoring and control.","Mitigation":"Promote and educate on the effective use of wearable sensors, and develop alternative monitoring methods.","Technologies":"Wearable sensor technology, alternative sensing technologies, public health education.","People":"Occupants, building users, public health officials.","Owner":"Public health authorities, building management, technology developers."},{"Description":"Dependence on large-scale datasets for AI models, which may not always be available or reliable.","Impact":"AI model performance may be compromised, leading to inadequate disease monitoring and control.","Mitigation":"Develop AI models that incorporate domain knowledge and can adapt to smaller datasets, invest in data collection and verification processes.","Technologies":"AI algorithms, domain adaptation techniques, data collection and verification tools.","People":"AI developers, data scientists, technology developers.","Owner":"Technology companies, research institutions, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Lack of incorporation of domain knowledge in data-driven AI models leading to suboptimal performance in disease monitoring and control.","Impact":"Reduced accuracy and effectiveness of AI models in monitoring and controlling diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Promote the incorporation of domain knowledge in AI model development, encourage collaboration between domain experts and AI specialists.","Technologies":"Domain knowledge integration tools, collaboration platforms, interdisciplinary training programs.","People":"Domain experts, AI specialists, data scientists.","Owner":"Research institutions, technology companies, public health authorities."}]}
